text: The 1120s was a decade that began on 1 January 1120, and ended on 31 December 1129. It is distinct from the decade known as the 113th decade which began on January 1, 1121 and ended on December 31, 1130. == Events and trends == * Romanesque sculptor Gislebertus does his work at Autun, Burgundy, France * 1121 Council of Soissons is does not like the work of Pierre Abélard * 1122 ** The problem of the Investiture Controversy in the Concordat of Worms is solved ** Pierre Abélard writes Sic et Non * 1123 ** First Council of the Lateran agree to the Concordat of Worms and the council says that priests must still be celibate ** The end of the reign of Emperor Toba, emperor of Japan. ** Emperor Sutoku becomes the emperor of Japan * 1124 Honorius II is elected pope * 1128 Geoffrey of Anjou marries Matilda who is the daughter of Henry I of England * 1128 Council of Troyes agree to the Order of the Knights Templar * 1129 Emperor Toba the emperor of Japan starts his cloistered rule.
title: 1120s
